newsitem.title: USA: US firm barred from offering FCC license services.
newsitem.headline: US firm barred from offering FCC license services.

text.p: A federal judge has barred Micom Corp and a top executive from offering any investment that involves a license or permit issued by the U.S. government, regulators said Friday.

The judge issued the order after upholding Federal Trade Commission charges that the New York-based company and Joseph Viggiano, its principal, ran a scheme involving bogus promises to help consumers apply for paging licenses issued by the Federal Communications Commission, the FTC said. The order includes a $1.6 million judgment and a ban on making false pitches involving investments or offerings over the phone.
